elements.title: Avelina Carrera (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Avelina Carrera (pictured) made her debut at the Liceu in Barcelona in 1889, stepping in as Elsa in Wagner's Lohengrin, and created the role of Maddalena in Giordano's Andrea Chénier at La Scala?

elements.title: Northup Avenue Yard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Northup Avenue Yard in Providence, Rhode Island, was described as "the finest in the New Haven system"?

elements.title: David Belchem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that David Belchem was awarded the DSO for leading a tank regiment in Tunisia that took 749 prisoners?

elements.title: forcibly establishing itself as a colonial reality (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to historian Rashid Khalidi, "Israel has been extremely successful in forcibly establishing itself as a colonial reality in a post-colonial age"?

elements.title: Michael Phillips (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2022, Michael Phillips became the third professor in a year to sue Collin College for retaliating against protected speech?

elements.title: Spy Princess (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Spy Princess by Shrabani Basu tells the story of Noor Inayat Khan, a British secret agent in France who was executed by the Nazis?

elements.title: Julian MacKay (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Julian MacKay moved to Moscow at the age of 11 to attend the Bolshoi Ballet Academy, and later became the first American to complete both the lower and upper schools there?

elements.title: milk's gotta lotta bottle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that milk's gotta lotta bottle?
